newsitem.title: UK: Halma drops as profit upsets market.
newsitem.headline: Halma drops as profit upsets market.

text.p: Shares in British safety and environmental group Halma Plc dropped on Tuesday after the company reported a lower than expected pre-tax profit.
By 0730 GMT the stock was down 13-1/2p to 176-1/2p.
Earlier Halma said its pre-tax profit for the financial year ending March 29, rose to 37.1 million stg from 33.6 million stg, not matching the analysts' consensus of 39 million stg.
"People were a bit disappointed by the figures", one trader said.
Halma said it would also recommend a capitalisation issue. Pending the approval of the AGM, holders of three ordinary shares will get one Ordinary share, it said.
